messages.title: Working for a fairer society
messages.content: I will be working for a fairer deal for young people, the elderly and the 'working poor' on poverty wages. Young people need proper pay, apprenticeships, secure jobs and housing that is really affordable. The elderly need care that is seamless between home and hospital. The Tories have savaged social care budgets with the result that the remaining six council-run care homes in Surrey have been earmarked for closure. Jill will be fighting for those on poverty wages, a ban on exploitative zero-hour contracts and fair agreements for agency workers. Fairer taxation will ensure that the burden falls on the rich rather than the poor.

messages.title: I will fight for
messages.content: your NHS, more nurses and GPs and lower waiting times and to end poverty wages, exploitative zero-hour contracts and insecure agency work; equal opportunities, to narrow the gap between rich and poor; a future for young people, with real jobs and affordable housing; a better deal for the elderly, with joined-up health and social care

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jill pledges more NHS workers, including nurses and GPs, and lower waiting times.
End poverty wages, ban exploitative zero-hour contracts, ensure fair agreements for agency workers, and promote fairer taxation so the rich bear a greater burden.
Promote equal opportunities to narrow the gap between rich and poor.
Jill will fight for a future for young people that includes real jobs and affordable housing.
Ensure a better deal for the elderly with seamless care between home and hospital and manage social care budgets effectively.

issues.economy: Jill plans to end poverty wages and introduce fair taxation.
issues.health: More NHS workers, including nurses and GPs, and lower waiting times.
